tajweedLaws.name: Idzhar
tajweedLaws.summary: When a nun sakinah or tanwin meets the letters of idzhar, it is pronounced clearly and distinctly.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Bigunnah
tajweedLaws.summary: When a nun sakinah or tanwin meets the letters of idgham bigunnah, it is pronounced with a nasal sound.
tajweedLaws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bigunnah means nasal sound. ...

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Bilagunnah
tajweedLaws.summary: When a nun sakinah or tanwin meets the letters of idgham bilagunnah, it is pronounced by merging without nasal sound.
tajweedLaws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bilagunnah means without nasal sound. ...

tajweedLaws.name: Iqlab
tajweedLaws.summary: When a nun sakinah or tanwin meets the letter qalqalah, it is pronounced by replacing it with the letter mim.
tajweedLaws.detail: Iqlab means to merge or, in simpler terms, to replace the letter with the letter mim. ...

tajweedLaws.name: Ikhfa
tajweedLaws.summary: When a nun sakinah or tanwin meets the letters of ikhfa haqiqi, it is pronounced softly.
tajweedLaws.detail: Ikhfa means to conceal or hide, while haqiqi means real or true. ...

tajweedLaws.name: Idzhar Syafawi
tajweedLaws.summary: When a mim sakinah meets the letters of idzhar syafawi, it must be pronounced clearly even with closed lips.

tajweedLaws.name: Ikhfa Syafawi
tajweedLaws.summary: When a mim sakinah meets the letters of ikhfa syafawi, it is pronounced softly by disguising the sound with a nasal tone.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Mimi
tajweedLaws.summary: Apabila mim mati bertemu dengan huruf idgham mimi, maka dibacanya melebur menjadi satu.
tajweedLaws.detail:
Huruf idgham mimi hanya satu, yaitu huruf mim. Jadi, idgham mimi adalah pertemuan dua huruf mim. Cara melafalkannya sama seperti melafadzkan mim yang bertasydid. Sebab, mim tasydid merupakan gabungan dari mim mati dan mim hidup.
huruf Idgham mimi: م
examples: وَكَمْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ Mim mati bertemu dengan م
كُلَّمَا أَضَاءَ لَهُمْ مَشَوْا فِيهِ Mim mati bertemu dengan م
إِلَيْكُمْ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ Mim mati bertemu dengan م

tajweedLaws.name: Gunnah
tajweedLaws.summary: If there is a shaddah on the letter mim (مّ) and nun (ن), it is pronounced with a nasal sound and is called Ghunnah.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Mutamasilain
tajweedLaws.summary: When a letter meets a similar letter, with the same makhraj and sifat, where the first letter is sukun (silent) and the second letter has a harakah.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Mutajaanisain
tajweedLaws.summary: Apabila ada suatu huruf yang sukun berhadapan dengan huruf yang berharakat, kedua-duanya itu sama makhrojnya tapi lain sifatnya.
tajweedLaws.detail: Cara menbacanya adalah dengan memasukkan atau mengidghom-kan huruf pertama pada huruf yang kedua.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Mutaqooribain
tajweedLaws.summary: Apabila ada huruf bersukun bertemu dengan huruf yang berharokat kedua huruf itu berdekatan makhroj dan sifatnya.
tajweedLaws.detail: Cara membacanya adalah dengan memasukkan atau mentasydid-kan huruf pertama pada huruf yang kedua.

tajweedLaws.name: Idzhar Qamariyah
tajweedLaws.summary: When a lam ta’rief meets the letters of idzhar qamariyah, it must be pronounced clearly.

tajweedLaws.name: Idgham Syamsiyah
tajweedLaws.summary: When a lam ta’rief meets the letters of qamariyah, other than idzhar qamariyah, it is called idgham.

tajweedLaws.name: Qalqalah Sughra
tajweedLaws.summary: If there is a silent qalqalah letter in the middle of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah sughra.

tajweedLaws.name: Qalqalah Kubra
tajweedLaws.summary: If there is a silent qalqalah letter at the end of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah kubra.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Wajib Muttasil
tajweedLaws.summary: If MAD THOBI'II meets a living HAMZAH (ء) within a word/sentence, it is mandatory to prolong it.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Jaiz Munfassil
tajweedLaws.summary: The recitation rule is called MAD JAIZ MUNFASHIL when MAD THOBI'II (ء) is in a different word.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Lazim Mutsaqqal Kilmi
tajweedLaws.summary: If MAD THOBI'II is faced with letters with shaddah within a word.
tajweedLaws.detail: The pronunciation should be prolonged first for 3 alif or 6 harakah before shaddah is added.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Lazim Mukhaffaf Kilmi
tajweedLaws.summary: If MAD THOBI'II meets a sukun-harokat letter not at the end of a word. (prolonged up to three alif or six harakah).

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Layyin
tajweedLaws.summary: If there is a MAD letter, whether it is WAW SUKUN or YAA' SUKUN preceded by a fathah-harokat letter.
tajweedLaws.detail: It is pronounced softly and smoothly.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Arid Lissukun
tajweedLaws.summary: If there is Mad Thobi'i or Mad Layyin followed by a waqof (stopping place).

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Shilah Qashirah
tajweedLaws.summary: If the letter HAA DLOMIIR / third person pronoun () comes after a vowel-harokat letter and is not connected to a sukun or shaddah letter or the letter alif.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Shilah Thawilah
tajweedLaws.summary: If Mad Shilah Qoshiroh meets HAMZAH (ء) preceded by a vowel-harokat letter.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Iwad
tajweedLaws.summary: If there are two fat-ha vowels ( ) falling on waqof (pause), at the end of a sentence (except for ta' marbuthoh), or mentioned as a replacement for tanwin so that it is no longer pronounced.

tajweedLaws.name: Mad Badal
tajweedLaws.summary: If HAMZAH ( ) meets MAD from a sukun-hamzah, and this hamzah is changed and replaced with ALIF ( ), WAU ( ).
tajweedLaws.detail: It is pronounced by prolonging it for one alif or two harakah, like MAD THOBI'II.
